repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: Local 1199 Executive Secretary Moe Foner Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Retail, Wholesale, and Department Store Union (RWDSU)

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: RWDSU Local 1199 Drug and Hospital Employees Union

did.abstract: Records of the National Union of Hospital and Health Care Employees document the evolution of the Retail, Wholesale and Department Store drugstore local, representing pharmacists and drug clerks in New York City, into an international union of non-professional and professional workers in voluntary and non-profit health institutions, including hospitals, clinics and nursing homes, as well as drugstores.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Between 1933 and 1957, 1199 functioned as a drugstore local with its membership growing to 5,000 workers employed in independent and chain drugstores throughout the New York metropolitan area. With its success in organizing workers in Montefiore Hospital in New York City, the union began a massive campaign to organize workers in voluntary and non-profit hospitals in the New York area, a large proportion of whom were black or Hispanic.

In 1973, the national union was established with locals in other states, including Pennsylvania, Maryland, South and North Carolina, Connecticut, New Jersey, and Massachusetts. The union combined organizing efforts with civil rights organizations, in an effort to achieve mutual political goals. Throughout the period of these records, the union was led by Leon Davis (president of Local 1199 and of the national union) whose administration guided the union's political and social activities.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Local 1199 Executive Secretary Moe Foner Records #5206-S. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

controlaccess.subject: Health facilities -- Labor unions -- United States
Strikes and lockouts -- Health facilities -- United States
controlaccess.corpname: Retail, Wholesale, and Department Store Union
National Union of Hospital and Health Care Employees. District 1199
Retail, Wholesale, and Department Store Union. Local 1199 Drug and Hospital Employees Union (New York, N.Y.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence and press releases from union staff and others regarding the 1969 strike/lock-out at Brooklyn's Adelphi Hospital. Contains statement by Coretta Scott King. Contains telegram and statement by Congresswoman Shirley Chisholm. Contains statement by New York State Assemblyman Seymour Posner. Contains Preliminary Injunction against Leon Davis and 1199 granted by NYS Supreme Court Judge Charles J. Beckinella.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings from various newspapers regarding the 1969 strike/lock-out at Brooklyn's Adelphi Hospital. Contains clippings regarding the granting of union representation at Adelphi Hospital in 1940.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence and press releases regarding Moe Foner's winning the 1958 American Public Relations Association's Sliver Anvil Award.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings from various newspapers regarding the organization of hospital workers in Baltimore, especially Johns Hopkins. Clippings contain references to support provided by Coretta Scott King, Rev. Ralph Abernathy, Walter Reuther, and Mary Moultrie.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence and press releases regarding the Angela Davis Legal Defense Fund. Correspondents include Angela Davis, Gloria Steinem, Ossie Davis, Adele Kanter, and Marvel Cooke.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings from various newspapers regarding the organization of hospital workers in Duke Hospital, Durham, N.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence regarding "1199 Drug News," mostly from the ALF-CIO offices. Correspondents include Ralph Bellamy, Leo Perlis, Oscar Jager, Edgar B. Nixon, Stuart P. Brock, and Saul Miller.

did.unittitle: Exhibitions - "Andrews, Benny and Mary Ellen Andrews." Mary Ellen Andrews: Photographs" exhibit at Gallery 1199.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, invitations, and exhibit catalog regarding the "People: Benny Andrews: Works on Paper;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, invitations, clippings, exhibit catalog, and other material regarding the opening exhibit, Alexander Dobkin's "War and Peace: Paintings, Drawings, and Lithographs," at Gallery 1199. Contains exhibit photographs. Contains exhibit guest register.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, invitations, clippings, exhibit catalog, and other material from two Max Ginsberg exhibits. "Recent Paintings" at the Harbor Gallery in 1969, and "Max Ginsberg" at Gallery 1199 in 1972. Contains a 1970 issue of American Artist magazine featuring an article on Max Ginsberg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, clippings, invitations, exhibit catalog, and other material regarding the "Paintings, Sculpture, Photographs by Members of 1199" exhibit at Gallery 1199. Exhibit featured work by forty-one union members, or relatives of union members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, invitations, exhibit catalog, and other material regarding the Anton Refreigier "Peace, War, and the Freedom Struggle" exhibit at Gallery 1199. Contains exhibit guest register for both the Anton Refreigier exhibit and the Max Ginsberg exhibit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, invitations, exhibit catalog, and other material regarding the "Harlem Artists, '71: an Exhibition of Paintings" exhibit at Gallery 1199. Exhibit featured work by eleven artists from the Studio Museum, Harlem. Contains exhibit register.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, invitations, and other material regarding the "The Black Woman: Genesis of a New Nation" exhibit at Gallery 1199. Exhibit feature work by fourteen artist from "Where We At" Black Women Artist's Group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence regarding the production of a short, half-hour, documentary film on the Charleston, S.C., hospital strike.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains purchase orders pertaining to the production of a short, half-hour, documentary film on the Charleston, S.C., hospital strike.

did.unittitle: I Am Somebody. Bills and Receipts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains bills and receipts pertaining to the production of a short, half-hour, documentary film on the Charleston, S.C., hospital strike.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains draft minutes of the 20May1972 conference. Contains text of Leon Davis's 19May1972 speech. Contains July 1972 issue of "1199 News" with report on conference.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence. Contains correspondence regarding the 20May1972 conference.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Workshop Materials. Contains recorders' notes for various workshops, as well as other material pertaining to the 20May1972 conference.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains reading material from the 12Jun1971 conference. Includes "Statement of Leon J. Davis," "Statement of Leonard Woodcock," keynote speech by John L. S. Holloman, David Mechanic paper "Inequality, Health Status, and the Delivery of Health Services in the United States, along with other material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, statements, and draft bills for legislation regarding the rights of working people. Correspondents include A. Philip Randolph; Harry Van Arsdale; Jay Kramer; William H. Booth; John V. Lindsay; Jay Rubin; Nelson A. Rockefeller; George K. Wyman; Leon J. Davis; U.S. Senators Jacob K. Javits, Robert F. Kennedy; U.S. Congressmen Joseph P. Addabo, John S. Rooney, Paul A. Fino, James H. Scheuer, Herbert Tenzer, Leonard Farbstein, Jacob H. Gilbert, Eugene J. Keogh, William F. Ryan, Jonathan B. Bingham, Benjamin S. Rosenthal; NYS Senator Max B. Berking; NYS Assemblymen Martin Psaty, Moses Weinstein, Ivan Warner, George L. Ingalls, Aileen B. Ryan, Shirley Chisholm, Harold L. Fisher, and Anthony J. Travia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, statements, and draft bills for legislation regarding the rights of working people. Correspondents include Harry Van Arsdale; William H. Bowe; Morris Iushewitz; Leon J. Davis; U.S. Senator Thomas A. Laverne; U.S. Congressmen Joseph P. Addabo, John S. Rooney, Paul A. Fino, James H. Scheuer, Leonard Farbstein, Jacob H. Gilbert, Eugene J. Keogh, William F. Ryan, Jonathan B. Bingham, Benjamin S. Rosenthal, James J. Delaney, Seymour Halpern, Adam C. Powell, Theodore R. Kupferman, John M. Murphy, Hugh L. Carey, Abraham J. Multer, Edna F. Kelly, Emanuel Celler, Jenalee D. Nivens; NYS Assemblymen Seymour Posner, Frank G. Rossetti.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, statements, and draft bills for legislation regarding the rights of working people. Correspondents include Harry Van Arsdale; William H. Bowe; Morris Iushewitz; Nelson A. Rockefeller; Robert R. Douglass; Stephen A. Hopkins; Victor Borella; Henry E. Manning; Leon J. Davis; U.S. Senators Thomas A. Laverne, Jacob. K. Javits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, statements, and draft bills for legislation regarding the rights of working people. Correspondents include Lewis L. Levine; Theodore Weiss; Edward Margulies; Stephen A. Hopkins; Leon J. Davis; NYS Senators John J. Marchi, Tarky Lombardi, Leon E. Giuffreda, Thomas A. Laverne; NYS Assemblymen Stanley Steingut, Alexander Chananau, Martin Ginsberg, Chester J. Straub.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unemployment Insurance Bill. Hospital Workers. Contains correspondence and statements for legislation regarding unemployment insurance. Correspondents include Leon J. Davis, Nelson A. Rockefeller; Robert R. Douglass; Max Greenberg; Max Steinboch; U.S. Senators Jacob K. Javits, Robert F. Kennedy; U.S. Congressmen Eugene J. Keogh, Hugh L. Carey, James J. Delaney, Edna F. Kelly, Paul A. Fino, Theodore R. Kupferman, William F. Ryan; NYS Senator William Thopmson; NYS Assemblymen Frank G. Rossetti, Shirley Chisholm, Ivan Warner, and Anthony J. Travia
